full_text:
Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 743 Filed 08/10/22 Page 44 of 247 172 LBUVMAX2 Visoski - direct
1 A. A passenger manifest is a document that we recorded what time we actually took off and landed. It had the date of the flight, it had the exact time of departure and arrival, and it also had a column for the name of the passengers that were on the aircraft.
2 Q. Who completed the passenger manifest for each flight that was piloted for Mr. Epstein?
3 A. Whoever was captain on the aircraft that day would complete that form.
4 Q. What does it mean to be captain?
5 A. To be captain would be to fly in the left seat and be in total control of the aircraft.
6 Q. How long after each flight did the captain complete the passenger manifest?
7 A. It was done immediately after the aircraft, within an hour.
8 Q. Between approximately 1994 and 2004, what did you do with the passenger manifests that you personally completed?
9 A. They would acquire them. After about 30 days, I would take them to the main office in New York and then drop them off.
10 Q. Did you keep a copy for yourself?
11 A. No, I did not.
12 Q. If you did not know the name of a particular passenger on a flight, how will you indicate the presence of that passenger in a passenger manifest?
13 A. I tried to be as accurate as I could. If I didn't know a
SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00011816

1 A. A passenger manifest is a document that we recorded what time we actually took off and landed. It had the date of the flight, it had the exact time of departure and arrival, and it also had a column for the name of the passengers that were on the aircraft.
2 Q. Who completed the passenger manifest for each flight that was piloted for Mr. Epstein?
3 A. Whoever was captain on the aircraft that day would complete that form.
4 Q. What does it mean to be captain?
5 A. To be captain would be to fly in the left seat and be in total control of the aircraft.
6 Q. How long after each flight did the captain complete the passenger manifest?
7 A. It was done immediately after the aircraft, within an hour.
8 Q. Between approximately 1994 and 2004, what did you do with the passenger manifests that you personally completed?
9 A. They would acquire them. After about 30 days, I would take them to the main office in New York and then drop them off.
10 Q. Did you keep a copy for yourself?
11 A. No, I did not.
12 Q. If you did not know the name of a particular passenger on a flight, how will you indicate the presence of that passenger in a passenger manifest?
